text: New York's 59th State Senate district is one of 63 districts in the New York State Senate. It has been represented by Republican Patrick M. Gallivan since 2011. ==Geography== District 59 stretches from the eastern suburbs of Buffalo to the southwestern suburbs of Rochester, including all of Wyoming County and parts of Erie, Livingston, and Monroe Counties. The district overlaps with New York's 25th, 26th, and 27th congressional districts, and with the 133rd, 138th, 142nd, 143rd, 144th, and 147th districts of the New York State Assembly. ==Recent election results== ===2020=== ===2018=== ===2016=== ===2014=== ===2012=== ===Federal results in District 59=== {| class=wikitable |- ! width="30" | Year ! width="60" | Office ! width="180" | Results |- | 2016 | President | align="right" | Trump 57.8 – 37.1% |- | rowspan="2" | 2012 | President | align="right" | Romney 53.2 – 45.0% |- | Senate | align="right" | Gillibrand 58.3 – 40.1% |} ==References== 59
title: New York's 59th State Senate district
